result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea hearing on May 9, 2022 at 03:10 pm.

Clerk: Heather.
Case Called:9:28 a.m.
INCLUDES: 20CM871, 21CM1191, 21CM1192, 21CM1228, 22CM40, 22CM41.

VRCW.

Atty Barnett makes note that Defendant has several OWI's that will be plead to, and because of that he will be remanded immediately.
Atty Rotter in agreement and request more time so Defendant can get his affairs in order prior to being remanded into custody.

ADA Barnett appears; Atty Rotter communicates with JA via phone requesting adjournment; Deft has new file; Atty Rotter will review; New PTC date set;
Amended Order Appointing Counsel - Increase cap by $500

Includes cases 22CM40 & 22CM41.  No contact with victim(s): Non waivable contact with W.M.D. or their residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No driving without valid DL. Prints and photograph.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 2:37 p.m.
INCLUDES: 20CM41, 22CM41.

State appears by ADA Alex Lech.  Defendant appears in person, pro se.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA: NOT GUILTY on CMs

Defendant indicates Atty Rotter is appointed to him on other cases.
Defendant sworn in and testifies.
COURT questions Defendant regarding income.
COURT finds Defendant indigent and appoints Atty Peter Rotter. Increase max by $500 and repayment same as previously ordered.

COURT ORDERS: $1,000.00 signature bond.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): Non waivable contact with W.M.D. or their residence.
- No driving without valid DL. 
- Prints and photograph. 

Defendant's Phone: 715-297-0136.
